composition.description: 1 Officer and up to 2 further soldiers

weapons.description: Pistol, submachine gun, rifle, or assault rifle as depicted on the models.

composition.description: 1 Forward Observer and up to 2 further soldiers

weapons.description: Pistol, submachine gun, rifle, or assault rifle as depicted on the models.

composition.description: 1 Medic and up to 2 further soldiers

weapons.description: Pistol or none as depicted on the models.

Headquarters.name: Chaplain

weapons.description: Pistol or none as depicted on the models.

rules: Inspiring Presence: Upon receiving his order die (except for Down), a chaplain may select one friendly unit within 6" and roll a D6, applying the following modifiers: Inexperienced -1, Veteran +1. On a 4+, the chaplain may remove 1 pin from the selected unit.
Non-Combatant: The chaplain is there to support the soldiers, not win battles. A chaplain unit cannot be used to claim or contest objectives.

Self-Defence Only: Clergymen are not soldiers and will not take part in hostile actions - they cannot fire any weapon, nor assault enemy units. However, there is anecdotal evidence of several examples of chaplains who broke regulations to carry a pistol for self-defence only; German chaplains were even issued with a pistol. If your chaplain is equipped with a pistol, it can only be used in close quarters if the enemy assaults him (including firing it at the assaulting enemies as a reaction, if applicable).

Infantry Squads and Teams.name: Heer Infantry Squad
rules: Bicycles: Bicycle-mounted infantry follow the same rules as infantry, except when moving entirely on a road, in which case they double their Run move to 24" (this move cannot be used to assault). In addition, the first time they receive any order other than Run, or if they receive a pinning marker, they dismount and abandon their bicycles for the rest of the game - replace the models with models on foot.

Infantry Squads and Teams.name: Heer Veteran Infantry Squad
rules: Bicycles: Bicycle-mounted infantry follow the same rules as infantry, except when moving entirely on a road, in which case they double their Run move to 24" (this move cannot be used to assault). In addition, the first time they receive any order other than Run, or if they receive a pinning marker, they dismount and abandon their bicycles for the rest of the game - replace the models with models on foot.

Infantry Squads and Teams.name: Panzergrenadier Squad (Stalingrad)
rules: Motorised Infantry: The Panzergrenadier squad can re-roll any failed order test that is required to mount or dismount a transport vehicle.

Infantry Squads and Teams.name: Jäger Squad
rules: Mountaineers (if taken): This unit treats rough ground as open terrain.

Infantry Squads and Teams.name: Sturmpioniere (Assault Engineer) Squad
rules: GrB-39 Grenade Launcher: Every time the model fires this weapon, you can choose either profiles
Sturmpistole: This weapon is treated like a Panzerfaust, except that it only has a range of 6" and a Pen value of +3. It can, however, be fired normally once a turn and not just once per game.

Infantry Squads and Teams.name: Fallschirmjäger Squad (Early War)
rules: Stubborn: Paratroopers don't give in easily! If forced to check their morale, then they always test on their full morale value, ignoring any pin markers.

Infantry Squads and Teams.name: Fallschirmjäger Squad (Late War)
rules: Stubborn: Paratroopers don't give in easily! If forced to check their morale, then they always test on their full morale value, ignoring any pin markers.

Infantry Squads and Teams.name: Gebirgsjäger Squad (Early War)
rules: Skis (if taken): Ski troops ignore movement penalties for snow and other winter conditions

Infantry Squads and Teams.name: Gebirgsjäger Squad (Late War)
rules: Skis (if taken): Ski troops ignore movement penalties for snow and other winter conditions

Infantry Squads and Teams.name: Volkssturm, Osttruppen or Inexperienced Infantry Squad

weapons.description: Sniper has a rifle and a pistol, spotter has a pistol
1 Infantry flamethrower or 2 one-shot infantry flamethrowers

Infantry Squads and Teams.name: Light Mortar Team
rules: No Smoke Rounds: This mortar cannot fire smoke

Tanks.name: Panzer III

weapons.description: 1 Turret-mounted medium anti-tank gun with co-axial MMG and 1 forward facing hull-mounted MMG

rules: Reinforced Rear Armour: The Ausf H and J treat hits against the rear armour as hits against the side armour

weapons.description: 1 Turret-mounted heavy anti-tank gun with co-axial MMG and 1 forward facing hull-mounted MMG

Tanks.name: Panther

weapons.description: 1 Turret-mounted super-heavy anti-tank gun with co-axial MMG and 1 forward facing hull-mounted MMG

rules: The Panther's heavy frontal armour has a rating of +1 giving it the same frontal value as a heavy tank (10+)

Armoured Cars.name: SdKfz 221, 222 and 223 Light Armoured Car

weapons.description: 1 turret-mounted light autocannon and co-axial MMG

rules: Panzerbüchse: Counts as a light anti-tank gun, and in addition its squeeze-bore system means that ranges of up to 12", its base armour penetration is increased by two to a total of +6, at over half range armour penetration is reduced by two instead of the usual one to a total of +2.

weapons.description: 1 turret-mounted light autocannon and co-axial MMG
1 turret-mounted medium anti-tank gun and co-axial MMG
